result.execSummary:
The defendant James Matthew Farrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Meet with DOC representative within 48 hours.

miscConds.notes: Court costs totaling $443.00.    If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Do not possess/consume mind altering substances.  No drugs or alcohol.  Take prescription medication as prescribed and only as prescribed.
Maintain absolute sobriety.    Defendant is to submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: TAD participant rights statement and participant contract

This bond is in effect until disposition of the case or until modified by the court.    We are obtaining your social security number for collection purposes per Wis. Stats. 71.935.  Disclosing your social security number to us is considered voluntary on your part.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety; not to consume any mind altering substances, except prescriptions but take only as prescribed.  Defendant is not to enter any establishments whose main source of income is from the sale of intoxicating beverages; no bars or taverns.  This bond covers Bayfield County cases 15CM149 and 15CM152.
11-18-2015:  Condition of bond modified to include:  Defendant is to be monitored by TAD program in Bayfield County with random testing, regular meetings with TAD officer, community checks.
